answers.answer: I meant at, excuse the typos.

I'm having twins too :) Mine are in separate sacs and doc says 85% sure they are fraternal. I'm 9 weeks tomorrow and have been basically.on my deathbed feeling so nauseated and throwing up. Mine will be in separate cribs just because I've heard that having them sleeping together increases the SIDS risk. But I found this cool Graco pack n play bassinet combo that have two little Moses baskets that snap into the top. I'll use that while they are little. They get to sleep side by side but still separate that way. We have a 2 yr old little boy and we were only planning on having two kids and surprise!  Twins lol. So we're a but stressed about how to financially make it work but hey that's life!
Congrats by the way!

Oh yeah I know excatly what your talking about, the pack n play bassinet has rave reviews as a must have for infant twins. I'm going to put that on my register and hope I don't have to buy it myself. I'm also stressed out over how we're going make it work financially but I have faith we'll make it work.

Do you have any Once upon A Child's in your area? It's like a gently used store for kids stuff. Clothes toys everything. I plan on visiting that place a ton! I'm hoping I'll have another shower but since this is our second time I don't know if I will. I am anxiously waiting my 12 week appt to hear the heartbeats again. Do twins run in your fam?
I just found out yesterday that im pregnant with identical twins.   Im exactly 6 weeks today.
Congrats!
I will have to look into Once Upon a Time stores if we have one. Yes twins actually do run in my family, mine will be the fourth set.Congrats to all you expecting mommy's ;)
My twins are fraternal so they ate in seperate sacks meaning we could get our boy and girl in one stop lol.

I was convinced shortly after conceiving that it was twins!   Just had a weird hunch.   I was hoping for fraternal as they are lower risk and never imagined they'd be identical.   Now im just hoping that both of them continue to thrive and that I can carry them to a safe point.
You should have another shower! Twins are a big celebration why not!! Go for it: -)

I have fraternal (mine are girl & boy twins) they've always had their own stuff.. but they don't care.n they sleep w/ their twin, on their twin, by their twin, w/o their twin etc. For us, it's more convenient they have their own stuff.. Congrats on your bundles!! :-)

I know a woman you had identical twins sharing same sac and placenta. She did have to be delivered early, I think 32 weeks if I remember and they were in the hospital for a while but heck now they are doing amazing and are big healthy bright little girls that you can't tell.apart! Lol my son was born early at 35 weeks arena he has to spend a month in the hospital for his lungs which wasn't fun be we got through it and he's fine. I'm hoping the same thing you are though because even with fraternal.the risk.of preterm labor is high. Good luck to you
Hi.. Congrats to all expecting ladies. I am carrying twins too. Does anyone know about "Twin peak sign" ?
No what's that?
In my recent ultra sound report the radiologist mentioned that he observed placenta with large anterior and twin peak sign.

https://www.google.co.in/url?sa=t&source=web&rct=j&ei=DpsIVOH2MNOgugTGuoKADw&url=http://radiopaedia.org/articles/twin-peak-sign-1&cd=1&ved=0CBsQFjAA&usg=AFQjCNH7fGrSmYSNCeWCcTIet7AzZLsWQA&sig2=XAUOlk9BiJEMxWQ5S57LYg

Emilee99 are you now considered high risk because of your preterm delivery at 35 weeks?   I lost my son 6 months ago at 24 weeks due to preterm labor and delivery and am now very high risk for preTerm delivery again.   The fact that im pregnant with twins increases the risk astronomically,  but im trying not to think about it too much.

I was induced at 35 weeks for low fluid. Basically because of my pregnancy hypertension my placenta was starting to not make as much fluid. So it wasnt actually preterm labor. They told.me.they consider all twins high risk and all twins have a higher risk of preterm labor which isnt fun news :(  i just got diagnosed with pregnancy hypertension again. Ugh. My body does not handle being pregnant i guess. I hope yours go as long as possible and I'm sorry that happened to you. It doesn't mean it will happen again though. Try not to be stressed because I'm sure that will.make it worse. And they will probably be watching you like a hawk this time. Good luck!!
Todimi would that then indicate that you're pregnant with di-di twins? ?
Wow you already have pregnancy hypertension? ?  You were about 9 weeks, right?   Yes, ill try my best to keep my sanity :).
22 weeks pregnant with fraternal girls :0)

Yep. Apparently although I'm not convinced totally. But they did a 24 hr urine and said I had some protein so even though bp is normal at home they think it might be spiking when I don't know. I was diagnosed early last time too but I never had any swelling or pre-eclampsia. Heck I even wore my wedding rings up until the day I delivered. I think my office jumps the gun a bit and if your at all over 120/70 they diagnose you with it. I read twins and previous pregnancy hypertension are risk factors for getting it again. Yay! That's Me. Lol its funny though cuz as soon as my baby was out it was 115/60. My body just doesn't like babies :(

According to the analysis of the above website I think they are di chorionic and di amniotic. But, I am not very sure. I think I need to consult the radiologist and ask him. Am just wondering anyone of you have clear idea about this. Thank you.

I'm having twins! I'm 12 weeks 5 days today. So far the biggest kicker is the nausea, frequent urination and exhaustion but I'm loving every ultrasound seeing them grow. I haven't given it much thought yet but I think I'm going to have two cribs so they can have they're own space. I want to be a full time breastfeeder. I hope I can hang in there lol.
Does di chorionic and di amniotic twins have lesser high risk?

Emilee - my bp would always spike at the drs office to > 140/90 but was always prefect at home and even at work.   I honestly think that for me it was just anxiety.   They were sending me for a 24hr urine test though but I ended up going into labor before I got a chance to do it.  Did they mention to you anything about taking magnesium supplements?Todimi- yes, it's a lot lower risk than monozygotic twins.  How far along are you?

Also to answer the original question,  if everything goes well I plan on using separate cribs due to risk of SIDS.  I also think that I'll dress them differently. im afraid im not going to recognize them otherwise ;).  Do you ladies plan to dress your babies the same or differently?  Just curious.
No they didn't mention magnesium to me at all. My bp is the same way at the office. Everytime I go I'm thinking if they are okay and now with twins I'm double anxious lol.

Exactly! !  Low magnesium apparently contributes to preeclampsia.   Ive been taking 250mg magnesium supplements since im also high risk for preeclampsia.   You can take up to 350mg/day safely.   Of course run it by your dr.  Mine was fine with it.  Also told me to take extra folic acid because of the twins,  so I've been taking an afditional 400mcg folic acid per day.
I am acid at 15 weeks.And I am taking 5mg folic acid 2 tablets per day.
I meant at 15 weeks. Thanks tanjat. Glad to know they are at lower risk.
Congrats Tanjat. It's fun to have Identical twins. I wish you all the best.
OkGood to know. Thanks!  I will ask. 2 should all stay in touch since there are so many twins!!

question: Where's all my other twin mom's out? Please share your stories experiences, money saving tips, stresses etc. because I want to hear it all. Oh and let me know if your going to have your kids share a crib or buy two.I'm 9wks&1d today and I feel so blessed and chosen to be gifted with the honor of carrying two little angels. They been kicking my butt lately but I dont mind it much.
title: Twin Obsessed
